intro: Verbena officinalis var. grandiflora, commonly known as the common verbena, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of North Africa. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, brightly colored flowers, typically in shades of blue, purple, and pink. The plant produces small, oval-shaped leaves that are opposite along the stems. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, often growing in dry, rocky habitats. Verbena officinalis var. grandiflora is also known for its historical use in herbal medicine.
